message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the physical properties of substances. When substances are combined by pouring them together, they will mix together, resulting in a homogeneous mixture. Option (C) is the correct answer because coffee and hazelnut cream mix together when poured, forming a creamy and flavored beverage. Option (A) is incorrect because salt and oyster crackers do not mix together, they remain separate. Option (B) is incorrect because lettuce and roma tomato do not mix together, they can be combined in a salad but will still be visibly separate. Option (D) is incorrect because whole milk and cheese do not mix together, they are different dairy products.

This question requires basic knowledge about the properties of substances and their ability to mix. When substances are combined by pouring them together, they will mix if they are miscible, or able to dissolve into each other. Coffee and hazelnut cream are both liquid substances that are miscible, meaning they can mix together. Option (A) is incorrect because salt and oyster crackers do not mix together, they simply coexist. Option (B) is incorrect because lettuce and roma tomato do not mix together, they are separate components of a salad. Option (D) is incorrect because whole milk and cheese do not mix together, they are separate products made from milk.

This question requires basic knowledge about the behavior of substances when they are mixed together. When substances are combined by pouring them together, they will mix together to create a homogeneous mixture. Option (C) is the correct answer because coffee and hazelnut cream can be combined by pouring them together to create a mixed drink. Options (A), (B), and (D) are incorrect because they do not represent substances that can be easily mixed by pouring them together.

This question tests the understanding of basic chemistry and the principle of mixing substances. When substances are combined by pouring them together, they will mix if they are compatible and can dissolve or disperse in each other. Option (C), coffee and hazelnut cream, is the correct answer because when poured together, the coffee and cream will mix, creating a homogeneous mixture. Option (A), salt and oyster crackers, is incorrect because salt does not dissolve or mix with oyster crackers when poured together. Option (B), lettuce and roma tomato, is incorrect because they will not mix when poured together, as they are solid components that do not dissolve or disperse into each other. Option (D), whole milk and cheese, is incorrect because while they can be combined to make a dish like mac and cheese, they do not easily mix when poured together and require further processing to create a creamy mixture.

Option (C) is the correct answer because when coffee and hazelnut cream are poured together, they mix to create a flavored coffee with a creamy texture. Options (A), (B), and (D) are incorrect because they do not represent substances that would mix together in the same way. Salt and oyster crackers are solid and would not mix to create a new substance. Lettuce and roma tomato are fresh produce and would not mix to create a new substance. Whole milk and cheese are both dairy products and would not mix together to create a new substance.
